revised_title: A Simple Geometrical Construction for Approximating the Area of a Circle
tldr: The author presents a simple geometric construction that provides a very close approximation of the area of a circle. The method involves drawing a quadrant of a circle and constructing a chord within it, followed by a series of steps that result in an approximation with an error of less than one-fourth of a thousandth part of the side of a square with the same area.
